title: Lawyer says Lopez never violated house arrest
description:
(1 Aug 2017) Venezuela opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez never violated the conditions of his house arrest, his lawyer told a news conference in Caracas on Tuesday.  
Juan Carlos Gutierrez said the 46-year-old Lopez was pulled from his home and was taken to the Ramo Verde prison. 
The nation's highest court has said Lopez and former mayor Antonio Ledezma were removed from their homes early Tuesday after "official intelligence sources" determined there was an "escape plan" involving both men.
Venezuela's Supreme Court also said the two leading opposition figures have been jailed because they violated the terms of their house arrest.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/4b5a12d3237203053661ae4abfe612da 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
